message: $4 is the price of a coffee, the app is totally worth it.
Other then myself, who wants it?
I am going to create one for free.. I don't feel like paying $4
there is a convore app it is unofficial you just have to search the app store for it
I already did that  ..it's 3.99$ don't think it's worth it.
I don't drink coffee lol
Awesome! .. Thanks.
They should .. maybe they will but as young as Convore is maybe they already decided that they need the exposure more then the headache of sending the cease and desist order.... who knows.
the question is is it any good? If it kicks butt I'll pay $4. Has anyone tried it?

Ok, I took the plunge and so far it looks good. As far as the $3.99 price goes we should consider the limited market at this time. In other words this is what I would call a limited production item and as such they cost more.
By the way neither the iPhone or iPad app allow finding a group by URL. Going forward this needs to be fixed.
If it were say maybe 0.99 I'd try it, but I really don't know.

@john_blanton if you use convore a lot on your iPad I say go for it. I look at it this way I'm willing to spend $4 if it helps me demonstrate convore to others and thereby help the platform grow. After all, IMO without lots of users convore is just another good idea that went nowhere.
I'll put it to you plainly, I just finished paying bills and I don't have 4$ to spare right now, however your thoughts about convore platform growth are right on. :)
But I agree, an official iPad app is extremely necessary.
@apfeljonas a universal app would be good too.
The iPhone app needs a better UI, kind of like the Twitter app. Its
UI feels kind of cheap.
My paid version might not be as good as that dude's version... but should have the basic functionality

One thing the convore team is probably thinking about is a free iPad app should help with uptake. After all, if potential users can try convore on their iPad for free that should help. Therefore, when the convore team does release a FREE iPad app we need to all download and give it good ratings so it takes off.
@john_blanton "don't have 4$ to spare right now" please... like you'll spend the $4 a week from now. if don't want to pay for it, don't. just don't pull that lame excuse...
@ericflo what's your take on this
I'd also have no problem with paying for a decent client (could be a good way for them to monetize). If a developer puts in time to make a nice, useful app, then I'm happy to fund their coffee/beer.
I just bought the vorepad app. It's not bad (other than login bug - dialog doesn't appear in portrait mode), but an official one with a few more features would be nice too.

Just tried Cvore but it was incredibly crashy even with force quits. Will keep an eye on it for improvements, but was unusable for me as is.
@noahmittman mind telling me when it crashes and how do you reproduce it? I am in the process of remodifying the whole code
@noahmittman I would really appreciate the bug reports here https://convore.com/cvore/

@noahmittman I'd suggest you to quit all other apps running in the background when running Cvore, it crashes less often that way... will be pushing updates when ready, I am fixing all that stuff and adding new features.. apologize for that
